titleproper.value:
Park West Village Tenants Association Records
                    <num>TAM.333</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T19:30-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Park West Village Tenants Association Records

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The Park West Village Tenants Association represents the tenants of seven apartment buildings on New York City's Upper West Side (372, 382, 392, 400 Central Park West, and 784, 788, 792 Colmbus Avenue), built with with Federal subsidy in the late 1950s. The four Central Park West buildings have become condominiums. The Association seeks to preserve the rent stabilized, middle income status of the three remaining rental buildings, to ensure the proper maintenance of the property, and protect the rights of individual tenants of the buildings, and the tenants as a whole. The collection contains legal materials, government documents, minutes, reports, correspondence, newsletters, subject files, printed ephemera, and clippings. 
                <emph render="bold">NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.</emph>

p.value:
Open for research without restrictions. 
                <emph render="bold">NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.</emph>

The Park West Village Tenants Association represents the tenants of seven apartment buildings on New York City's Upper West Side (372, 382, 392, 400 Central Park West, and 784, 788, 792 Colmbus Avenue), built with with Federal subsidy in the late 1950s. The four Central Park West buildings have become condominiums. The Association seeks to preserve the rent stabilized, middle income status of the three remaining rental buildings, to ensure the proper maintenance of the property, and protect the rights of individual tenants of the buildings, and the tenants as a whole.

<c01 id="ref3" level="otherlevel">
                <did>
                    <unittitle>
                        <emph render="bold">Contents:</emph> Letters dated July 13 and August 11, 1993 concerning a roadway to be constructed on the property including buildings 372, 382, 392 and 400 CPW; A renters guide prepared by PWVTA in September 1992; Copies of covenants concerning the building of Park West Village; The Black Book and other papers pertaining to the Condominium Offering Plan for 392 CPW; The detailed history of the rent reduction and MCI battle between the tenants of 784, 788 and 792 Columbus Ave which began in 1993 and was finally settled in 2005.</unittitle>
                    <container id="cid19190002" type="Box" label="Mixed materials (31142050278814)">1</container>
                    <unitdate>1990s-2005</unitdate>
                </did>
            </c01>
            <c01 id="ref5" level="otherlevel">
                <did>
                    <unittitle>
                        <emph render="bold">Contents:</emph> Executive Board minutes and agendas 1991-1992; Legal material re: Balconies in 400 CPW; Fences Fight in CPW buildings in the early 1990s; PWVTA Membership lists 1993-1995, all seven buildings, and letters re conversion; CPW 400 Awning 1995; Early conversion material: brad brewwer argument, survey 5/28/1984, Court Case 372/382; Newsletters 1982-1988; Election 1991; Harassment casev (ambriose) 400 CPW; Roy Harris eviction case, mostly from 792 and 400 in 2000.</unittitle>
                    <container id="cid19190003" type="Box" label="Mixed materials (31142050278822)">2</container>
                    <unitdate>1980s-1990s</unitdate>
                </did>
            </c01>

                    <unitdate>1990s</unitdate>
                </did>
            </c01>
